intro: Cleome gordjaginii, commonly known as the desert spider flower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual with slender, branching stems and small, spider-like flowers that bloom in shades of pink to purple. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Cleome gordjaginii is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides in its native habitat.
